name: Traditional Chinese Scallion Pancakes
author: INSPIRON41
summary: This is a traditional Chinese scallion pancake. Usually eaten as a appetizer. It's easy to make!
ingredients: 2 ½ tablespoons vegetable oil, divided, or as needed
2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, or as needed
directions: Combine warm water, sugar, and yeast in a bowl
Add 1 cup flour; stir dough with a spatula
Mix the remaining 1 cup flour, hot water, 2 tablespoons oil, and salt together in a separate bowl until dough-like in texture
Add the dough from step 1; knead together into a round ball, dusting with flour as needed
Place dough ball on a lightly floured work surface; cover with a warm, damp towel for 30 to 40 minutes
Roll each out and sprinkle half the scallions on top
Roll up each piece into a tube; pinch each in half
Roll and flatten into large pancakes, dusting with flour, if needed
Heat the remaining oil in a skillet over medium heat
Cook pancakes until browned, 3 to 4 minutes per side
